title: Are there any song suggestions for what I should be performing at the K-pop audition? - Quora

response.answer_text: You should prepare songs in a language that you can speak fluently, so don’t do ones in Korean if you can’t speak a word of Korean. If you can speak Korean at an intermediate level, then I would try to do a song in Korean, although the judges may judge your pronunciation of the song. As for genres, probably kpop, pop or jpop (once again depending on what language you can speak) or any other genre that you enjoy/feel confident in singing. Song choice is up to you but these are some pop songs that I would use for my audition. Flashlight - Jessie J In The Name of Love - Martin Garrix and Bebe Rexha(probably do a verse because you will most likely sing acapella and there is a huge pause in the chorus so) Scared To Be Lonely - Martin Garrix and Dua Lipa Sunflower - Post Malone Clementine - Halsey(I would do a verse because in the chorus she sings ‘i don't need anyone’ and then she screams ‘i don't need anyone!’ and the same with ‘i just need everyone’) Bellyache - Billie Eilish(her vocals are quite high so if you are not a soprano, I wouldn’t recommend this one) Lily - Alan Walker(gets high in the chorus so either use a verse or don’t do it if you are not soprano) Faded - Alan Walker(is high but not ridiculously high so it should be manageable) Lover - Taylor Swift(high in the chorus) Graveyard - Halsey If you are doing rap for your audition: Black Widow - Iggy Azalea and Rita Ora(there is singing but just use one of the verses, verse 1 is easier than verse 2) Admit It - Tati McQuay See You Again - Wiz Khalifa and Charlie Put(rap bits are a bit short) Nightmare - Halsey And if you are dancing (I don’t have any choreography, but you can google these songs and see if there are videos with choreographies to them): Rescue Me - One Republic I Like It - Cardi B(I recommend the one Lisa did) Ice Ice Baby - Vanilla Ice Work Hard, Play Hard - DJ Jason Medallion Bury a Friend - Billie Eilish(Galen Hooks and Tina Boo are good ones) idontwannabeyouanymore - Billie Eilish Sweet but Psycho - Ava Max(Mina Myoung was one I liked)

Ok, so it really depends on the company, your vocal range, and weather you can speak Korean or not. If you can speak Korean then I would do a song in Korean to show that. But if you can't, then don't. This is a big thing a lot of people underestimate. The company's specifically say that they judge your pronunciation of the song. And if you are not Korean they might let you in because they think that you are bilangual, when you are not. As for song choice, this is really up to you. I can give some songs if you want to sing in Korean, but if you don't want to you can just skip this next section… Twice- Fancy, Feel special, Dance the night away, what is love. I would only do twices songs for any company other than the big 3. Twices songs are mostly soprano, but I guess if you are an Alto you could make them work. BTS- Lights, Save me, Magic shop. (I could probably do like 80 more, but I kept it small) I would only do a BTS song if you were going to audition for a smaller company. Their songs are mostly for Alto's and Bases. Stray kids- Get Cool, I am you, awkward silence, hellevator. Their songs are good for any company but the big 3. I would only do their songs if you naturally have a bit of a lower voice but can still sing some high notes. Black Pink- Kill this Love, Du-ddu-du-ddu-du. I personally would not audition for any company with their songs because of their companys reputation. Their songs are for Alto's and sopranos. Also be prepared to song multiple auditions if you are doing a global audition. That's all I could think of right now. Good luck on your audition :)

I don’t have any specific songs that you could sing, because I don’t know your vocal range. But what I can say, is that you sing a song that you are comfortable with, and is within your vocal range completely. Another thing is, that maybe you shouldn’t do a kpop song. Or at the very least, not a kpop song from the company that you’re auditioning for. If you do a kpop song, it is highly likely that your judges will think that it’s just because you like kpop so much to the point that you are willing to audition. If you’re singing a kpop song from the company, it just makes you seem like a desperate fan that’s wanting to get close to their idols, and that’s not good, like not good at all, because it could seriously hinder your audition. Being a fan is a terrible thing to come off as when auditioning, and you should steer yourself clear from that. Although you can mention your love for Kpop, it’s best not to be too enthusiastic when talking about your faves, because trust, it’s pretty obvious to the judges, and they don’t like fans. Remember what happened to GLAM (girl group from BigHit)? Well, it turns out that one of the members was a sasaeng fan. Of whom, I’m not entirely sure, but you get the idea. Hope this helped!

If you do not speak Korean well, SING A K-POP SONG. This will show the judges that you are able sing in Korean. However, practice it vigorously and ask others, preferably those who speak Korean, if you sound like a native speaker. If you sound confident in the language, then the judges will definitely remember you. DO NOT SING A SONG FROM A GROUP/SOLOIST THAT THE COMPANY MANAGES. The judges have probably heard songs like these for ages and you want to stand out. I wouldn’t recommend singing a song from a rival company (if you’re auditioning for JYP perhaps, you probably shouldn’t sing a song from a YG or SM group and vice versa). Pick a song that you know will leave a lasting impression on the judges. Do one that you know you can sing perfectly when the occasion calls for it. It doesn’t necessarily have to have high notes and belts and such. Just do one that you can sing flawlessly. And do one within your vocal range! If you strain too much, they will notice! These judges have to pick only a few trainees out of hundreds of people auditioning. If you have even the slightest slip up, that could be enough to knock you out of the competition. Be confident. Smile. And remember this: no matter what the outcome is, you will hopefully learn something that will help you in the future, whether it regards music or it regards life. Good luck!

Okay so, here are some reccomendations over how to chose a song : If you don’t know Korean or how to pronounce Korean words DONT sing a song in Korean.Sing a song to fit your voice if you are a Soprano, don’t try to sing singularity (at least on its original key), and if you are a baritone don’t sing What is love.Choose a song you would feel comfortable singing, if your vocal range is not very wide , do not sing Mariah Carey songs, or basically songs that are difficult for you. On the other hand if you can reach the high notes I would reccomend you to chose maybe not a difficult song, but a song that showcases your voice.If you want really want to sing a kpop song then I would recommend songs like eyes, nose, lips, an IU song, Ailee OSTs, etc. I would recommend you to sing solo songs instead of group songs as solo songs are designed for a soloist while group songs are designed for well…groups. (This are some recommendations, chose the song that adapts better to your voice).The same reccomendation if you would like to sing on English, Japanese, French, etc. Other songs I would recommend Hurt by Christina Aguilera, Disney or Musical Songs (although I don’t think singing opera would be suitable for the ocation), Halo by Beyoncé, etc.This is it, I hope this helped you to chose a song in some way. Good luck :).
response.upvotes: Answer requested by The Moonlight Girl

upvoters.user_id: Rose バイオレット Gacha

response.answer_text: Depends on your vocal range and the company. Two important things. Prepare 2 songs - one ballad and one “catchy” tune. Make sure you’re as perfect at both of them as can be. Then listen to the others around you, if everyone is doing w ballad use your pop song, and vice verse. But make sure to pick songs that show your range. Second, whoever you are auditioning for do not use a song from their company. Just don’t, kiss of death. If you’re using a track with back up vocals with just one person missing make sure you stick to their part. If you’re using a solo artist no worries. Make sure you can hit all the notes, if it’s beyond your range don’t do it. Use songs that work for you. I know I’m not suggesting particular songs (my daughter used Twinkle by TaeTiSo) but I don’t know your range or whether you’re a soprano 1, 2 or an alto 1 or 2. I don’t know how high of a note (or low) you can hit (and hold). So I advise you to pick songs you like (old or new) and see what fits your voice best. Sing it accapella in front of family or friends. If it fits you and you do well, there’s your song(s) - you could be asked to sing a second if they really like the first.

There is No best Rap song for auditioning. What you have to find out is that “What is your speciality?” The Rap Song that you can rap exceptionally well to. So you have to find this out yourself. I can give suggestions but you don’t have to rap these songs only. If you are not so good in korean i.e your pronunciation, flow, etc. Are not good it is better to try an English Rap. You can try- Rap God (I’ve tried the fastest verse of this one, its not that hard if you pay full attention to it) Speedom (Well this is umm…best of luck,I still have to try this so maybe you can) These are REALLY Fast so there is a greater chance of you making it with these if you can do it perfectly with that swag, flow, speed & body language. You can try any eminem or busta rhymes raps. They are amazing. If you are Really good in korean and you are sure that you won’t make any pronunciation mistake (Knowing hangul will help with this), you can go for any of the BTS’s Rap songs like cypher pt.3, cypher pt.2 , Outro:tear, Agust D, The Last, Joke, Intro:What am I to you, Intro: Nevermind,Intro:Persona etc. I would also suggest checking out Epik High because his raps are really amazing. You can even try Doom Dada by T.O.P. But same applies here “if you can do it perfectly with that swag, flow, speed & body language.” As your name says you are probably Indian. Please don’t mislead yourself in doing any Indian rap song because you cannot get in with Hindi songs. Only english and korean is allowed. And even if Hindi was allowed I would have suggested to avoid most famous Indian rappers and try out people like Gully Boy’s raps (Real one okay? Not the actor). Because let’s be Honest Honey Singh, also known as, Yo Yo Honey Singh was one of the first well known Indian rapper but his songs actually made me hate Raps. I thought Raps are useless and cringey till I found out BTS and Eminem (I would also Mention BTOB). Badshah has some swag but at the international level and especially, our topic kpop’s raps, his raps are upto the Girl group level raps. In English too, please don’t do Drake’s raps even if He is very popular. His raps are not actually raps. I speak faster than that. And there is hardly any swag that makes you go “Woah!”. I am not hating. I respect tgem really very much but just saying this so that you can plan out well. Because their raps are not going to work. I hope this helps.

Never auditioned for a kpop group or company but have auditioned for a school in the arts before. You should sing what ever is comfortable with your vocals. Singing takes strength and energy. If you sing a song requiring you to reach notes that you can’t or have not mastered yet, will harm your voice and most likely interfere with your results. Best thing to do is know your range. If they ask you to sing a specific song, maybe take a course on how to read music and find a key that will be in tune with another. If you can’t sing high, learn to compensate with singing a lower tone. But still sounds great. Nothing is worse than having a voice croak or squeak whilst trying to sing in tune with the music. From my experience, the worst part of my audition was that I could not sing the high notes well enough to pass, id squeak or croak… it made the playback video unbearable to watch. Comfortable but still impressive for your range.

Welp I'm not Korean and I don't know why I would be in a kpop audition but I guess I can use my imagination lol. Jin:Epiphany- if I want to make it in my kpop audition I have to let the judges to see me in a certain way. Epiphany can make the judges see as the visual type in a Kpop group. And you can show off ur vocals.Loona:Butterfly- butterfly is a sweet sounding song which can also show off ur vocals and it's a awesome song!Red velvet: bad boy- it can show u that bad girl concept and ur vocals and the way u sing.V: Singularity- u can show the judges that mature and slow paced side when u sing this song. (If u kinda have one like me lol.) U can also see how low and smooth ur vocals can go. And see how visual u can be.Welp folks these are the songs I would sing in my imaginary kpop audition for an imaginary kpop group, I'm kinda hoping for a imaginary kpop group full of visuals lol.

If you’re auditioning for a korean company, I actually don’t suggest that you sing a kpop song, unless you are korean/auditioning in Korea/are most comfortable speaking korean. I say this mostly because the judges, will probably judge you. Though if you do sing a korean song, shoot for something that’s not from the company you’re auditioning to ( don’t want them to think you’re a crazy fan/just auditioning to be able to see your idols ) and a song that’s within your vocal range and that’s not difficult for you to sing ( I personally wouldn’t pick a fast paced song if I wasn’t too familiar with the korean language ) I hope this helped! ^-^

Here's a bunch of Korean songs if you can pull off the pronunciation (would play to your advantage) : Spring Day - BTSEyes, Nose, Lips - TAEYANGBeautiful - CRUSHSorry - The Rose (And any of their other songs)One Of These Nights - Red VelvetAnd here's if you'll lose your mind pronouncing (pretty basic a list) : Diamonds - RihannaSecret Love Song - Little MixHeart Attack - Demi Lovato (or any other song of hers)Alive - SiaAll Of Me - John Legend

I can’t promise these work because Idk your vocal range, and I can only help with English songs but here are some songs- More vocal based songs Side to side- Ariana grande 7 Rings- Ariana grande Havana- Camilla cabello Dark horse- Katy Perry More rap based songs Bad blood- Taylor swift Beautiful pain- Eminem Clint Eastwood- Gorillaz Headlights- Eminem Wild Ones- Flo rida Monster- Eminem hope this helped, good luck!!!

response.answer_text: i mean i can just send you a list of songs that female main vocals are preferred to be able to sing, and I can do it, so if I can, everyone can Praying - Kesha (trust me, its just sucking in your stomach and belt it, super easy, vibrato can be easily added in) Speechless - Naomi Scott (you can adjust the tone and it wouldn't be as noticeable) Bridge Over Troubled Water - forgot the name, to lazy to search it up, its a song from the 70s, but hella good and I personally sang IntO tHe unKnoWNNNNNNNNNNNN hehe good luck

It really depends on what your talent is. If your talent in dancing, try songs with a difficult but smooth choreography like EXO- Growl, BTS- Man In Luv, DNA, G-Friend- Sunrise, SNSD- Genie, Into the New World, Seventeen - Home. If your talent is singing try singing difficult songs like IU Good Day, or songs by Rain, Roy Kim, Heize. If your talent is rap try songs by San-E, Zico, RM, Dynamic Duo, Simon Dominic, and Epik High.

I love the K-pop song “don’t cry” by EXO. The inspiration of this song is The Little Mermaid written in 1837. When the little mermaid turns 15, she falls in love with a prince. She asks the Sea Witch to give her legs in exchange for her voice. She hopes the prince would marry her and suffers a lot of pain for him but fails. The prince decides to marry the neighboring king’s daughter. Before dawn the little mermaid’s sisters bring her a knife from the Sea Witch. If she kills the prince with the knife and lets his blood drip onto her feet, she will become a mermaid again. But when she stands in front of his bed, she can not bring herself to do that. When the sun rises, she throws herself into the sea and her body dissolves into foam. In the song “Baby Don’t Cry’, the prince doesn't sleep, he wakes up and asks her to kill him. Don't hesitate, please take my heart. Baby dont cry tonight. When the dawn lights the skies, it will be as if nothing ever happened. You will never dissolve into foam, for my love is with you forever. So, baby dont cry cry.’”

Pick a song that suits your range and vocal strengths, and that represents the kind of music you want to make. Don’t challenge yourself to the point of breaking, or do something off-brand just to show you can. Also, don’t pick a song that is a big hit released by the same agency. The judges will have heard it a million times and will more easily pick up any small mistakes compared to the professional idols that have performed it dozens if not hundreds of times. That’s about all the advice I can give without knowing what agencies you are interested in or what kind of music you like.

It depends on which skill you’d like to showcase to the judges at the audition. Vocals: Ailee’s Heaven, Taeyeon’s U R/Rain/Fine, TTS’s Baby Steps, G.na’s Ill back off so you can live better, Luna/Krystal’s Calling out. Dance: personally I think you should come up with your own moves to a popular song and win the attention of the judges. Rap: it’s also better to come up with your own lyrics and beat.

U can sing any song but remember sing the songs which matches your voice and which song you think you can sing? The best songs for audition are: Rolling in the deepHelloI'll always love youStone coldMy heart will go onOne last timeToo good at goodbyes

Depends on what company you are going for. If you are auditioning for JYP, then I suggest singing a song that isnt by anyone from JYP. Same with the other companies. Its an unspoken rule. I personally like to use the song “Breathe” by Lee Hi for my auditions but when it came to me having to use a different song I either sang “still love you” by Lee Hong Ki or “Let me Know” by 방탄소년단. When it comes to auditions, I like to free myself with each song I choose, so when I auditioned I auditioned with Bruno Mars, Bangtan, Lee Hi, Lee Hong Ki, Eminem, NF, and other artists. It’s really good to show diversity in your song choices and if you’re bilingual or know other languages to also choose a song in that language that you can do to show off your skills in another language. Hope this helped!

Whatever songs that suites YOU. what you like.. which connects the most with you, the one you can relate the most. If its an audition then delivering a song that connects with you really pays off. Your delivery on the song become better. But keep in mind the song must be something you can deliver technic-wise. The high notes and low notes and such. Make sure you can pull it off.

I suggest spring day or butterfly by bts or any other song that can show off all your abilities if your better with high notes choose a high notes song or low notes choose a low notes song or if your good at both pick a song where the artist eventually hits high or low notes or make a song you really like your own. Honestly depending on who you try out for like if your auditioning for cube and you choose a song by an artist/artists that are apart of cube entertainment then eighther sing better than them or most likely you won't get picked.

An English song is the best option . Choose korean song only If you are fluent in korean and have confidence that pronunciation is correct. Also in English songs don't choose the songs of that company's idols , cuz they'll think u are coming for their idols. I got to know about this from a formal trainee so u can trust it:-)

Mainstream KPOP is an absolute NO NO. Just remember that. If you are dancing, existing choreographies are allowed If you are singing, they usually let you sing the chorus which is basically the “good part” or the part that shows of your voice quality the most Side note: Don’t wear kpop merch as well, keep a smile on and maintain eye contact with the judge. Nevertheless, fighting! -Ling

I can’t recommend a song if I haven’t heard your voice yet. But you should do a song in a language you are fluent with to not only help with memorization but also pronunciation. Also, sing a song that suits your voice and is in your vocal range yet shows off all your potential. If you have a powerful voice, choose a powerful song. If you have an emotional voice, choose an emotional song.

Any song really. depending on your skillset, you’d want to show a song that really shows your talent and passion. I will say though that JYP prefers if you don’t audition with songs from his artists. Good luck if you’re thinking of trying.

Not a kpop song if you are not korean because they would think that your are a koreaboo and not a song from the kpop companies kpop group. Perfom a song that best fits your voice/a song that shows your talent.
Anything that suits your voice that feels and sounds comfortable. Don’t over do it with high notes, if you can’t actually hit them.

It depends what kind of talent your going to show them. For example, some people chooses a slow song to show their vocals. It also depends if you are Korean or not because if you are a non-Korean, you need to choose at least an easier song. Good luck! :)

audition a song that you are comfortable with and you know already maybe like flashlight , skyscraper, titanium, or any other song you know actually dont get pressured to choose a song just choose the one that seems right to you

Yeah, choose a song that you can sing well. Something that makes your voice shine. You don’t really need to sing in korean (a lot of idols auditioned with english songs), but if you’re not korean it can be a plus.
I am not sure, but I read somewhere that so of the pueces where in English. Just pick what makes you shine the most.
